result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea A Ashford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 25 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim, co-actors, gang members or anyone convicted of a drug crime.   Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Andrea A Ashford in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Andrea A Ashford in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates he wishes to plead guilty but does not wish to accept the State's offer. Defendant does not trust Ms. Kuehn's explanation that it doesn't work that way. Defendant Andrea A Ashford in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Andrea A Ashford in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant, OM.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   No contact with victim store, Landmark Credit Unions. You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Andrea A Ashford in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Andrea A Ashford in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
